revised_title: Edmund Langley Hirst: A Pioneering Carbohydrate Chemist
tldr: Edmund Langley Hirst was a prominent British chemist known for his work in carbohydrate chemistry. He made significant contributions to the understanding of sugar structures and ring systems, and his research on plant gums, mucilages, and starch had a lasting impact on the field. Hirst worked with notable scientists like Sir Norman Haworth and Robert Robinson, and his career spanned various prestigious institutions, including St. Andrews University, Manchester University, and Edinburgh University.
